CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1955, pg. 21, reads: "MARBLES CHAMP HAILED - A goodly crowd turned out at City and County Building Monday to pay tribute to Raymond Jones Jr., 12, of 1015 North Franklin Street, who was crowned U. S. marbles champion by Mayor David L. Lawrence. Raymond won the national title at Asbury Park, N. J., last week.  Seated, left to right, with the new champ, are Mayor Lawrence and Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Jones, Sr., the boy's parents... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of man, 1955 national marbles champion Raymond Jones Jr., and Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Jones Sr., seated in booth with crown inscribed "Asbury Park," in Crawford Grill No. 2 with upside down tree patterned wallpaper
